question: フランス語
sourceMnemonic: I bet you can guess that <ja>フランス</ja> means "France." So what happens when you add <kanji>language</kanji> to it? You get the "France Language" aka the <vocabulary>French Language</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is just the on'yomi reading for <ja>語</ja> which is the reading you learned with the kanji. This is probably because it gets added onto a lot of other words so it's treated like a jukugo. For example: <ja>日本語</ja> = "Japanese Language." <ja>中国語</ja> = "Chinese Language." <ja>スペイン語</ja> = "Spanish Language."
